content: Create a regex pattern to match all lowercase hexadecimal words

To match all lowercase hexadecimal words using a regular expression (regex), you can use the following pattern:

```regex
\b[a-f0-9]+\b
```

Here's a breakdown of the pattern:

- `\b`: Asserts a word boundary, ensuring that the match occurs at the start and end of a word. This helps in matching standalone words.
- `[a-f0-9]+`: Matches one or more characters that are either a lowercase letter from 'a' to 'f' or a digit from '0' to '9'. This is the core part that identifies lowercase hexadecimal characters.
- `\b`: Again asserts a word boundary at the end of the word.

This regex pattern will match words consisting entirely of lowercase hexadecimal digits.
